greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(2n) = A129194(2n)/2; a(2n+1) = A129194(2n+1).
comment: The moment generating function of p(x, m=2, n=1, mu=2) = 4*x*E(x, 2, 1), see A163931 and A274181, is given by M(a) = (-4 * log(1-a) - 4 * polylog(2, a))/a^2. The series expansion of M(a) leads to the sequence given above. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 03 2016
Multiplicative because both A129194 and A040001 are. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 26 2018
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
John M. Campbell, An Integral Representation of Kekulé Numbers, and Double Integrals Related to Smarandache Sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1105.3399 [math.GM], 2011.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,3,0,-3,0,1).
formula: a(n) = n^2/b(n), where b(n) = [1, 4, 1, 4, ...] is a purely periodic sequence of period 2. Thus a(n) is a quasi-polynomial in n.
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^(2*e-2) for e > 0, and a(p^e) = p^(2*e) for prime p > 2.
Dirichlet convolution with A259346 equals A000290.
maple: a := proc(n): n^2*(5-3*(-1)^n)/8 end: seq(a(n), n=0..46); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 03 2016
mathematica: f[n_] := Numerator[(n/2)^2]; Array[f, 60, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 18 2012 *)
program: (MAGMA) I:=[0,1,1,9,4,25]; [n le 6 select I[n] else 3*Self(n-2)-3*Self(n-4)+Self(n-6): n in [1..60]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 10 2016
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Nov 18 2009
